Uses of Class
laazotea.indi.client.INDIValueException

  • Packages that use INDIValueException 
    Package Description
    laazotea.indi.client
    Provides the classes necessary to create INDI Clients, connections to INDI Servers and to inspect and modify INDI properties of Devices.

    • Uses of INDIValueException in laazotea.indi.client

      Checks if a desired value would be correct to be applied to the BLOB Element.
      abstract boolean INDIElement.checkCorrectValue(java.lang.Object desiredValue)
      Checks if a desired value would be correct to be applied to the Element according to its definition and limits.
      boolean INDILightElement.checkCorrectValue(java.lang.Object desiredValue)
      Always returns true.
      boolean INDINumberElement.checkCorrectValue(java.lang.Object desiredValue)
      Checks if a desired desiredValue would be correct to be applied to the Number Element.
      boolean INDISwitchElement.checkCorrectValue(java.lang.Object desiredValue)
      Checks if a desired value would be correct to be applied to the Switch Element, that is a SwitchStatus object.
      boolean INDITextElement.checkCorrectValue(java.lang.Object desiredValue)
      Checks if a desired value would be correct to be applied to the Text Element.
